intro: Clidemia ceramicarpa, commonly known as the Ceramica shrub, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its attractive appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
